Could not reproduce this one.  I was able to open the editor on the correct 
extension without problems.  
Note however that I am using the latest pde code from head.  However, the 
piece of code that threw a class cast exception in this case has not changed.

We are calling IWorkbenchPage.openEditor(IEditorInput, editorId) and we know 
for a fact what the type of the editor returned is.  So I'm not sure why there 
was a class cast exception in your case.

Improved steps to reproduce the problem:
- select plugin.xml for org.eclipse.ui.ide in Navigator or Package Explorer
- Open With > Text Editor
- Ctrl+H 
- search for refs to extension point org.eclipse.ui.ide.markerImageProviders
- double-click on match in org.eclipse.ui.ide

The spec for IWorkbenchPage.openEditor states:
 * If this page already has an editor open on the target input that editor is 
 * activated; otherwise, a new editor is opened. 

So you can't assume that you'll always get back your class of editor.
thank you for enlightening me.  I'll take care of it.
Was able to reproduce and fix.  The problem was as Nick explained.
